Available from: https://www.aium.org/resources/guidelines/reproductiveMed.pdf.

Ultrasound Obstet Gynecol. 2010 Jan;35(1):103-12. doi: 10.1002/uog.7487. PMID: 20014360. Available from: https://obgyn.onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1002/uog.7487.

This artefact includes content from SNOMED Clinical Terms® (SNOMED CT®) which is copyrighted material of the International Health Terminology Standards Development Organisation (IHTSDO). Where an implementation of this artefact makes use of SNOMED CT content, the implementer must have the appropriate SNOMED CT Affiliate license - for more information contact https://www.snomed.org/snomed-ct/get-snomed or info@snomed.org.

details.purpose: *To record the findings on radiological examination of the uterus, and their interpretation. (en)
details.use:
*Use to record the findings on radiological examination of the uterus, and their interpretation.
The intended scope for this archetype is to eventually record all detailed findings on radiological examination of the uterus using any modality. It is anticipated that further data elements may be added as requirements are identified and confirmed.
This archetype is designed to be nested within the 'Structured imaging findings' SLOT in the OBSERVATION.imaging_exam_result, but can also be used within other ENTRY or CLUSTER archetypes, where clinically appropriate. Use to provide a framework in which CLUSTER archetypes can be nested in appropriate SLOTs: - Details about the imaging examination of one or more gestations will be recorded using the 'Pregnancy findings' SLOT; - Details about the imaging examination of the uterine cervix will be recorded within the 'Cervical findings' SLOT; - Details about the imaging examination an intrauterine device (IUD) will be recorded within the 'IUD findings' SLOT; and - Details about other imaging findings such as structural abnormalities or lesions will be recorded using the 'Additional findings' SLOT. (en)
details.misuse:
*Not to be used to record imaging examination findings for any body structure or region other than the uterus. Use other archetypes from the CLUSTER.imaging_exam family for this purpose.
Not to be used to record details related to the overall findings, context or technical details related to a complete imaging examination test result. Use the OBERSERVATION.imaging_exam_result for this purpose. For example, comments on the study quality, differential diagnoses, and overall impression. (en)

details.purpose: For å registrere funn ved radiologisk undersøkelse av livmor og tolkning av funnene.
details.use:
Brukes for å registrere funn ved radiologisk undersøkelse av livmor og tolkning av funnene.
Det tiltenkte omfanget for denne CLUSTER.imaging_exam (Bildediagnostisk undersøkelse) - arketypen er til slutt å kunne registrere alle detaljerte funn ved bildediagnostisk undersøkelse av livmor uavhengig av modalitet. Det er forventet at flere dataelementer kan bli lagt til når krav til slike er identifisert og bekreftet.
Denne arketypen er utformet for å bli nøstet i SLOT'et "Strukturerte funn" i OBSERVATION.imaging_exam_result (Bildediagnostisk svar), men kan også brukes innen andre ENTRY- og CLUSTER-arketyper der det er klinisk passende. Bruk som et rammeverk der flere CLUSTER-arketyper kan nøstes inn i deres respektive SLOT: - Detaljer om bildediagnostisk undersøkelse av en eller flere gestasjoner skal registreres i SLOT'et "Funn ved graviditet" - Detaljer om bildediagnostisk undersøkelse av livmorhals skal registreres i SLOT'et "Funn ved livmorhals" - Detaljer om bildediagnostisk undersøkelse av innsatt intrauterint prevensjonsmiddel (IUD) skal registreres i SLOT'et "Funn ved IUD" - Detaljer om andre bildediagnostiske funn, som strukturelle abnormaliteter eller lesjoner, skal registreres i SLOT'et "Ytterligere detaljer"
details.misuse:
Skal ikke brukes til å registrere funn fra undersøkelser av andre kroppsstrukturer enn livmoren. Bruk andre arketyper fra gruppen av CLUSTER.imaging_exam-arketyper for dette.
Skal ikke brukes til å registrere overordnede undersøkelsesfunn, kontekst eller tekniske detaljer relatert til billedundersøkelsen. Bruk arketypen OBSERVATION.imaging_exam_result (Bildediagnistisk svar) for å registrere for eksempel kommentar om undersøkelseskvalitet, differensialdiagnose og overordnet konklusjon.

details.purpose: To record the findings on radiological examination of the uterus, and their interpretation.
details.use:
Use to record the findings on radiological examination of the uterus, and their interpretation.
The intended scope for this archetype is to eventually record all detailed findings on radiological examination of the uterus using any modality. It is anticipated that further data elements may be added as requirements are identified and confirmed.
This archetype is designed to be nested within the 'Structured imaging findings' SLOT in the OBSERVATION.imaging_exam_result, but can also be used within other ENTRY or CLUSTER archetypes, where clinically appropriate. Use to provide a framework in which CLUSTER archetypes can be nested in appropriate SLOTs: - Details about the imaging examination of one or more gestations will be recorded using the 'Pregnancy findings' SLOT; - Details about the imaging examination of the uterine cervix will be recorded within the 'Cervical findings' SLOT; - Details about the imaging examination an intrauterine device (IUD) will be recorded within the 'IUD findings' SLOT; and - Details about other imaging findings such as structural abnormalities or lesions will be recorded using the 'Additional findings' SLOT.
details.misuse:
Not to be used to record imaging examination findings for any body structure or region other than the uterus. Use other archetypes from the CLUSTER.imaging_exam family for this purpose.
Not to be used to record details related to the overall findings, context or technical details related to a complete imaging examination test result. Use the OBERSERVATION.imaging_exam_result for this purpose. For example, comments on the study quality, differential diagnoses, and overall impression.

translations.author: Peter Fedorcsak, Vebjørn Arntzen, Marit Alice Venheim
University of Oslo, Oslo University Hospital, Helse Vest IKT
peterfe@uio.no, varntzen@ous-hf.no, marit.alice.venheim@helse-vest-ikt.no

items.items: The length of the entire uterus.
Usually measured in the midsagittal plane, from the outer serosal surface of the fundus to the external os of the cervix.
Usually measured at the widest dimension in the transverse or coronal plane, perpendicular to the length.
The anteroposterior height of the uterus.
Usually measured in the midsagittal plane anteroposteriorly from outer to outer serosal surfaces.

For example: focal abnormalities, endometrial midline, vasularisation, and fluid or masses in the cavity. Record structured details about any lesion using the CLUSTER.imaging_exam-lesion and related specialisations nested within the 'Additional details' SLOT.
Maximal measured thickness of the endometrium.
Description about the endometrial echogenicity compared with the echogenicity of the myometrium.

For example: contour changes, texture, masses, and cysts as well as symmetry between the anterior and posterior segments of the myometrium. Record structured details about any morphological abnormality using CLUSTER.imaging_exam-lesion nested within the 'Additional details' SLOT.
Description about the junctional zone between the endometrium and the myometrium.
The relation between uterus and the vagina in the sagittal plane.
The uterus is angled forward relative to the vagina.
The uterus and the vagina are in the same plane.
The uterus is angled backward relative to the vagina.
The relation between uterine body and the cervix in the sagittal plane.
The presence or absence of an intrauterine device.
An IUD is observed in the uterus.
No IUD is observed in the uterus.
It is not possible to determine if an IUD is present or absent.
Measured thickness of the junctional zone.
The presence or absence of an intrauterine pregnancy.
Evidence of one or more intrauterine pregnancies are observed - gestational sac, embryo or foetus.
It is not possible to determine if an intrauterine pregnancy is present or absent.
Findings on radiological examination of the uterus.
Identification of the body structure or region examined.
If the body structure has been fully identified in this 'Body structure' element, then the 'Body site' data element and 'Structured body site' SLOT becomes redundant.
The length of the body of the uterus.
Usually measured in the midsagittal plane, from the outer serosal surface of the fundus to the internal os of the cervix.
Additional structured details about imaging findings about examination of the uterine cervix.
Additional structured details about imaging findings about one or more intrauterine pregnancies.
Structured details about imaging findings for an intrauterine device.

For example: to carry the location of the IUD *within the uterus* only; or details about the IUD device. If an IUD is located outside of the uterus, the IUD details should be recorded within the imaging archetype relevant for region or structure in which the IUD is located.
Increased echogenicity of the endometrium, compared to the myometrium.
Similar echogenicity of the endometrium, compared to the myometrium.
A triple line pattern of the endometrium is observed.
The echotexture of the endometrium is uniform.
The echotexture of the endometrium is not uniform.
Description about the homogeneity and symmetry of the endometrium.
Endometrium appears homogeous with symmetrical anterior and posterior sides. It may also include the three-layer pattern.
Endometrium appears heterogenous with asymmetrical anterior and posterior sides and cysts.
Description about the interface between the opposing surfaces of the two endometrial walls.
A straight hyperechogenic interface within the endometrium is observed.
A wavy hyperechogenic interface within the endometrium is observed.
An irregular or interrupted hyperechogenic interface within the endometrium is observed.
The absence of a hyperechogenic interface within the endometrium is observed.
Decreased echogenicity of the endometrium, compared to the myometrium.
The junctional zone is not visible or well defined.
Imaging examination of a body structure
Findings on radiological examination of a specified body structure or region.
Identification of the body structure or region examined.

For example: 'Liver', 'Right ankle' or 'Lymph node group'. Coding of the body structure with an appropriate terminology, such as SNOMED CT, is recommended. If the body structure has been fully identified in this 'Body structure' element, then the 'Body site' data element and 'Structured body site' SLOT become redundant.
Identification of the area of the body under examination.

For example: a lymph node group (body structure) which found in the 'Right axilla'. Coding of 'Body site' with a terminology, such as SNOMED CT, is desirable. If the body site has been fully identified in the 'Body structure' data element, this data element becomes redundant.
Structured details about the area of the body under examination.

For example: details about a relative anatomical location, such as '2cm distal to the appendix'. If the body site has been fully identified in the 'Body structure' or 'Body site' data elements, then this SLOT becomes redundant.
Narrative description of the imaging findings observed during this examination.
Additional structured details about imaging findings for the identified body structure or region, or findings of related structures.
Single word, phrase or brief description that represents the clinical meaning and significance of all imaging findings for the identified body structure.

Also referred to as 'Interpretation' or 'Opinion'. For example: 'No abnormality detected' or 'Free fluid present'. Coding of the 'Impression' with a terminology is permitted, if useful. Multiple occurrences allow for more than one coded impression. A narrative description may include a comparison with previous studies of the identified body structure, if appropriate.
Additional narrative about the imaging findings of the body structure, not captured in other fields.
Som regel måles i midsagittalt, langsgående snitt fra den ytre serosaoverflaten ved fundus til den ytre livmormunnen.
Som regel målt ved den bredeste utstrekningen i aksialplanet, vinkelrett på lengden.
Som regelt målt i midsagitalt plan anterio-posterialt fra ytre kant av serosa til serosa.

*For example: focal abnormalities, endometrial midline, vasularisation, and fluid or masses in the cavity. Record structured details about any lesion using the CLUSTER.imaging_exam-lesion and related specialisations nested within the 'Additional details' SLOT. (en)
*Description about the endometrial echogenicity compared with the echogenicity of the myometrium. (en)

*For example: contour changes, texture, masses, and cysts as well as symmetry between the anterior and posterior segments of the myometrium. Record structured details about any morphological abnormality using CLUSTER.imaging_exam-lesion nested within the 'Additional details' SLOT. (en)
*Description about the junctional zone between the endometrium and the myometrium. (en)
*The relation between uterus and the vagina in the sagittal plane. (en)
*The uterus is angled forward relative to the vagina. (en)
*The uterus and the vagina are in the same plane. (en)
*The uterus is angled backward relative to the vagina. (en)
*The relation between uterine body and the cervix in the sagittal plane. (en)
Livmorkroppens akse peker fremover i forhold til livmorhalsens akse.
Vinkelen mellom livmorkroppens akse og livmorhalsens akse peker bakover.
*The presence or absence of an intrauterine device. (en)
Det er ikke mulig å bestemme om intrauterin spiral er tilstede eller ikke.
Som regel måles i midsagittalt, langsgående snitt fra den ytre serosaoverflaten ved fundus til den indre livmormunnen.
*Additional structured details about imaging findings about examination of the uterine cervix. (en)
*Additional structured details about imaging findings about one or more intrauterine pregnancies. (en)
*Structured details about imaging findings for an intrauterine device. (en)

*For example: to carry the location of the IUD *within the uterus* only; or details about the IUD device. If an IUD is located outside of the uterus, the IUD details should be recorded within the imaging archetype relevant for region or structure in which the IUD is located. (en)
Tilstedeværelse eller fravær av et intrauterint svangerskap.
*Evidence of one or more intrauterine pregnancies are observed - gestational sac, embryo or foetus. (en)
*It is not possible to determine if an intrauterine pregnancy is present or absent. (en)
Funn ved radiologisk undersøkelse av livmor.
Navn av undersøkt struktur eller område i kroppen.
Dersom den aktuelle strukturen i kroppen er fullt ut angitt i dette "Kroppsstruktur"-elementet er det ikke nødvendig å bruke "Anatomisk lokalisasjon" eller "Strukturert anatomisk lokalisasjon".
*Increased echogenicity of the endometrium, compared to the myometrium. (en)
*Similar echogenicity of the endometrium, compared to the myometrium. (en)
*A triple line pattern of the endometrium is observed. (en)
*The echotexture of the endometrium is uniform. (en)
*The echotexture of the endometrium is not uniform. (en)
*Description about the homogeneity and symmetry of the endometrium. (en)
*Endometrium appears homogeous with symmetrical anterior and posterior sides. It may also include the three-layer pattern. (en)
*Endometrium appears heterogenous with asymmetrical anterior and posterior sides and cysts. (en)
*Description about the interface between the opposing surfaces of the two endometrial walls. (en)
*A straight hyperechogenic interface within the endometrium is observed. (en)
*A wavy hyperechogenic interface within the endometrium is observed. (en)
*An irregular or interrupted hyperechogenic interface within the endometrium is observed. (en)
*The absence of a hyperechogenic interface within the endometrium is observed. (en)
*Decreased echogenicity of the endometrium, compared to the myometrium. (en)
*The junctional zone is not visible or well defined. (en)
Funn eller observasjoner ved radiologisk undersøkelse av et definert organ eller en kroppsdel.
Identifisering av organet eller kroppsdelen som svaret gjelder.

For eksempel "Lever", "Høyre ankel" eller "Lymfeknutegruppe". Det er anbefalt å kode kroppsstruktur med en passende terminologi, som SNOMED CT. Dersom den aktuelle strukturen i kroppen er fullt ut angitt i dette "Kroppsstruktur"-elementet er det ikke nødvendig å bruke "Anatomisk lokalisasjon" eller "Strukturert anatomisk lokalisasjon".

For eksempel en lymfeknutegruppe (Kroppsstruktur) som er funnet i "Høyre aksille" (Anatomisk lokalisasjon). Det er ønskelig å kode "Anatomisk lokalisasjon" med en terminologi, som SNOMED CT. Dersom den anatomiske lokalisasjonen er fullt ut angitt i elementet "Kroppsstruktur" er det ikke nødvendig å bruke "Anatomisk lokalisasjon".
Strukturerte detaljer om organ eller kroppsdel.

For eksempel detaljert om en relativ anatomisk lokalisasjon, som "2 cm distalt for appendix". Dersom den nøyaktige eller relative anatomiske lokalisasjonen er fullt ut angitt i elementet "Kroppsstruktur" er det ikke nødvendig å bruke "Strukturert anatomisk lokalisasjon".
Fritekstlig beskrivelse av funn eller observasjoner på bilder tatt under denne undersøkelsen.
Ytterligere strukturerte detaljer om funn eller observasjoner på bilder for det definerte organet eller kroppsdelen, eller om funn eller observasjoner hos tilhørende kroppsstrukturer.
Enkeltord, frase eller kortfattet beskrivelse som uttrykker den kliniske betydningen av alle funn og observasjoner for den definerte kroppsstrukturen.

Kan også kalles "Tolkning" eller "Inntrykk". For eksempel "Uten anmerkning" eller "Fri væske". Dersom det er nyttig, er det åpent for å kode "Resymé" med en terminologi. Flere svar kan kodes ved at elementet er åpent for å være gjentakende. En beskrivelse i fritektst kan også brukes og kan inneholde en sammenligning med tidligere undersøkelser av samme kroppsstruktur.
Ytterligere fritekst om funn eller observasjoner på bilder av kroppsstrukturen og som ikke er fanget i andre felt.
Usually measured in the midsagittal plane, from the outer serosal surface of the fundus to the external os of the cervix.
Usually measured at the widest dimension in the transverse or coronal plane, perpendicular to the length.
*Usually measured in the midsagittal plane anteroposteriorly from outer to outer serosal surfaces. (en)

*For example: focal abnormalities, endometrial midline, vasularisation, and fluid or masses in the cavity. Record structured details about any lesion using the CLUSTER.imaging_exam-lesion and related specialisations nested within the 'Additional details' SLOT. (en)
Maximal measured thickness of the endometrium.

*The uterus is angled forward relative to the vagina. (en)
*The uterus and the vagina are in the same plane. (en)
*The uterus is angled backward relative to the vagina. (en)
*The relation between uterine body and the cervix in the sagittal plane. (en)
*The presence or absence of an intrauterine device. (en)
An IUD is observed in the uterus.
No IUD is observed in the uterus.
It is not possible to determine if an IUD is present or absent.
Measured thickness of the junctional zone.
The presence or absence of an intrauterine pregnancy.
*Evidence of one or more intrauterine pregnancies are observed - gestational sac, embryo or foetus. (en)
*It is not possible to determine if an intrauterine pregnancy is present or absent. (en)
*Findings on radiological examination of the uterus. (en)
Identifizierung der untersuchten Körperstruktur oder Region.
*If the body structure has been fully identified in this 'Body structure' element, then the 'Body site' data element and 'Structured body site' SLOT becomes redundant. (en)
*The length of the body of the uterus. (en)
*Usually measured in the midsagittal plane, from the outer serosal surface of the fundus to the internal os of the cervix. (en)
*Additional structured details about imaging findings about examination of the uterine cervix. (en)
*Additional structured details about imaging findings about one or more intrauterine pregnancies. (en)
*Structured details about imaging findings for an intrauterine device. (en)

*For example: to carry the location of the IUD *within the uterus* only; or details about the IUD device. If an IUD is located outside of the uterus, the IUD details should be recorded within the imaging archetype relevant for region or structure in which the IUD is located. (en)
*Increased echogenicity of the endometrium, compared to the myometrium. (en)
*Similar echogenicity of the endometrium, compared to the myometrium. (en)
*A triple line pattern of the endometrium is observed. (en)
*The echotexture of the endometrium is uniform. (en)
*The echotexture of the endometrium is not uniform. (en)
*Description about the homogeneity and symmetry of the endometrium. (en)
*Endometrium appears homogeous with symmetrical anterior and posterior sides. It may also include the three-layer pattern. (en)
*Endometrium appears heterogenous with asymmetrical anterior and posterior sides and cysts. (en)

*An irregular or interrupted hyperechogenic interface within the endometrium is observed. (en)

Befunde zur radiologischen Untersuchung einer bestimmten Körperstruktur oder -region.
Identifizierung der untersuchten Körperstruktur oder Region.

*For example: 'Liver', 'Right ankle' or 'Lymph node group'. Coding of the body structure with an appropriate terminology, such as SNOMED CT, is recommended. If the body structure has been fully identified in this 'Body structure' element, then the 'Body site' data element and 'Structured body site' SLOT become redundant. (en)
Identifizierung des zu untersuchenden Bereichs des Körpers.

Zum Beispiel: eine Lymphknotengruppe (Körperstruktur), die sich in der „rechten Achselhöhle“ befindet. Eine Kodierung von „Körperstelle“ mit einer Terminologie, wie z. B. SNOMED CT, ist wünschenswert. Wenn die Körperstelle im Datenelement „Körperstruktur“ vollständig identifiziert wurde, wird dieses Datenelement überflüssig.

Zum Beispiel: Angaben zu einer relativen anatomischen Lokalisation, wie z. B. „2 cm distal zum Blinddarm“. Wenn die Körperstelle in den Datenelementen „Körperstruktur“ oder „Körperstelle“ vollständig identifiziert wurde, wird dieser SLOT überflüssig.
Beschreibung der bei dieser Untersuchung beobachteten bildgebenden Befunde.
Zusätzliche strukturierte Angaben zu bildgebenden Befunden für die identifizierte Körperstruktur oder -region oder befundbezogene Strukturen.
Einzelnes Wort, Satz oder kurze Beschreibung, die die klinische Bedeutung und Signifikanz aller bildgebenden Befunde für die identifizierte Körperstruktur darstellt.

Auch als „Eindruck“ oder „Meinung“ bezeichnet. Zum Beispiel: „Keine Anomalie erkannt“ oder „Freie Flüssigkeit vorhanden“. Eine Kodierung des „Interpretation“ mit einer Terminologie ist zulässig, sofern sinnvoll. Mehrere Vorkommen ermöglichen mehr als eine codierte Interpretation. Eine einfache Beschreibung kann gegebenenfalls einen Vergleich mit früheren Studien der identifizierten Körperstruktur beinhalten.
Zusätzlicher Text über die bildgebenden Befunde der Körperstruktur, der in anderen Bereichen nicht erfasst wurde.
